rows.text_1: Let’s check in on another family to see how talking about feelings helps them in a practical way:

rows.text_2:
{F1_FATHER} : “{F1_DAUGHTER_6}, I have 5 minutes to spend One-on-One Time with you. What would you like to do?”
 {F1_DAUGHTER_6} : “Let’s play with the ball outside!”

{F1_DAUGHTER_6} : “I can’t do it!”
 {F1_FATHER} : “I see that your hands are tight and you are speaking loudly. It looks like you are upset, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}. It’s not easy, let’s practise a little bit more. I know you can do it.”

{F1_FATHER} : “Five catches in a row! You seem really proud to have made it to five, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}!”
 {F1_DAUGHTER_6} : “Let’s do 10!”
{F1_FATHER} : “Well done, my girl. I am very happy to be able to spend this special time with you, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}.”

rows.text_1: Let’s reflect on what {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_6} did.
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: To show {F1_DAUGHTER_6} he is paying attention
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That’s right. By naming {F1_DAUGHTER_6}’s emotions, {F1_FATHER} models an important skill.
rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: To help {F1_DAUGHTER_6} learn to recognise her own emotions
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: That’s right. By naming {F1_DAUGHTER_6}’s emotions, {F1_FATHER} models an important skill.
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: To show {F1_DAUGHTER_6} that her emotions are normal
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That’s right. By naming {F1_DAUGHTER_6}’s emotions, {F1_FATHER} models an important skill.
rows.quiz_1_option_4_text: To help {F1_DAUGHTER_6} learn how to talk about her emotions
rows.quiz_1_option_5_text: To support and encourage {F1_DAUGHTER_6} to keep trying
rows.quiz_1_feedback_5: That’s right. By naming {F1_DAUGHTER_6}’s emotions, {F1_FATHER} models an important skill.
rows.quiz_2_question: What can we learn from {F1_FATHER} in how he talks about {F1_DAUGHTER_6}’s emotions?
rows.quiz_2_feedback_1: Yes, {F1_FATHER} shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_2: Yes, {F1_FATHER} shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.
rows.quiz_2_option_3_text: He uses words to describe {F1_DAUGHTER_6}’s emotions
rows.quiz_2_feedback_3: Yes, {F1_FATHER} shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.
rows.quiz_2_option_4_text: He shares his own feelings with {F1_DAUGHTER_6}
rows.quiz_2_feedback_4: Yes, {F1_FATHER} shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_5: Yes, {F1_FATHER} shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.
rows.quiz_3_question: What would have happened if {F1_FATHER} had criticised or ignored {F1_DAUGHTER_6}’s frustration?
rows.quiz_3_feedback_1: Correct. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn new skills.
rows.quiz_3_option_2_text: The same problem would happen again next time
rows.quiz_3_feedback_2: Correct. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn new skills.
rows.quiz_3_feedback_3: Correct. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn new skills.
rows.quiz_3_option_4_text: {F1_DAUGHTER_6} would not have learned how to catch a ball
rows.quiz_3_feedback_4: Correct. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn new skills.
